questionListItems.title: Is it necessary for my child to wear a mask during the entire course?

answer.body: Mask-wearing is optional, activities in OBS is conducted in the outdoors so participants can choose not to wear mask when performing strenuous activities.

questionListItems.title: Are students allowed to bring snacks?

answer.body:
Breakfast, lunch and dinner, with light snacks will be provided for your child, hence they do not have to bring any extra snacks. Do encourage your child to have a heavy breakfast before reporting to OBS on Day 1.


OBS does not allow for students to bring their own snacks as there are students with food allergies who may be exposed to unknown food ingredients.

questionListItems.title: How do I contact my child in the event of a family emergency?

answer.body: You may contact your child via the school teacher as your child’s mobile phone will be kept by OBS to ensure security of personal items and minimal distraction during the course. However, due to the expeditionary nature of the course, we seek your understanding that some time is needed for OBS to reach your child.

questionListItems.title: What is the MOE-OBS Challenge Programme?

answer.body: The MOE-OBS Challenge Programme consists of 3-part, before-OBS lessons, the OBS component and post-course lessons taught by school teachers. The OBS course is led by OBS Instructors. It is designed to ensure achievement of learning outcomes and transfer of learning to other areas of the student’s life. Students are not graded for performance but are encouraged to work on goals they set for themselves.

questionListItems.title: Which type of expedition will my child be going? Will my child go for land or water expedition or both?

answer.body: There are various modes of expedition, and some examples include trekking, kayaking and rowing. Please note that this list is not exhaustive. Students will experience one or more of these modes depending on the course. The Course is designed such the various modes of expedition are different ways in which the students can achieve the learning outcomes. The different activities have also been designed to provide a similar level of challenge.

questionListItems.title: Where will the students be sleeping in case of rain?

answer.body: Students will sleep in tents during the course. Depending on weather conditions, location of the group and available resources at that point, students may seek shelter at a suitable/nearby location if necessary.

questionListItems.title: Will there be washrooms or toilets available if the students are camping outdoors at night?

answer.body: We have toilet and shower facilities in OBS campuses. The programme is expeditionary in nature. When students embark on their activities out of OBS campuses, such as the parks, they will also have access to public toilets. For campsites that do not have toilet, the instructors will provide guidance to the students on how to do toileting.

questionListItems.title: Will the students get to shower daily?

answer.body: In the OBS campus, there will be downtime after activities where students will be allowed to shower. Outside the OBS campus where shower facilities may not be available, Instructor will provide guidance to the students on maintaining personal hygiene (using wet wipes and powder, and to change to fresh set of clothes)

questionListItems.title: Will students receive formal feedback on their performance/behaviour and their strengths and areas for improvement?

answer.body: The MOE-OBS Challenge Programme is designed for students to interact with peers from other schools and work together to overcome outdoor challenges. After the OBS course, students will continue the last phase of the programme in their own schools. There is no formal feedback on their individual performance or behaviour during the OBS course.

questionListItems.title: Is there any food or drink vending machine in the campus?

answer.body:
There is no food or drink vending machine in campus.

Breakfast, lunch and dinner, with light snacks will be provided for the students. Some examples of the food given will be:

Breakfast - Breads, biscuits, or muffins; Lunch - Wrap with tuna/salmon spread, energy bar or Meal-ready to eat; Dinner - Rice, noodle, canned food for outdoor cooking.

Students are encouraged to have a heavy breakfast before reporting to OBS on Day 1.

questionListItems.title: What is the expected dismissal time on the last day? Can I fetch my child from the OBS campus?

answer.body:
On the last day of the course, students are usually dismissed and handed over to their teachers in the early afternoon from the OBS campus.


Students will take the busses back to school. For ease of traffic management, handing over of students from schools to parents should be done back in school.

questionListItems.title: Will there be any photos taken and shared with the schools or parents?

answer.body: There will not be any photos taken during the course except for a group photo printed in hardcopy for students' memory keep-sake. Parental consent for photo-taking and sharing is required, thus OBS aligned with MOE’s requirement not to take and share photos unless arrangement with schools is made to secure parental consent.

questionListItems.title: Is there toilet at the OBS campuses?

answer.body: Yes, there are toilets and showering facilities at all OBS campuses.

questionListItems.title: Will the student be given a choice to select activities that they are interested in?

answer.body: Students will not be allowed to choose the type of activities to participate. The OBS course is designed such that despite the different types of activities, students can achieve almost the same learning outcomes.

questionListItems.title: What is the menu for the students during the camp?

answer.body:
Breakfast, lunch and dinner, with light snacks will be provided for the students. Some examples of the food given will be:


Breakfast - Breads, biscuits, or muffin;

Lunch - Wrap with tuna/salmon spread, energy bar or Meal-ready to eat;

Dinner - Rice, noodle, canned food for outdoor cooking.

Students are encouraged to form their own group menu and utilise all the issued food items by the end of the camp.
